question: In internal fragmentation, memory is internal to a partition and ____________
options: ['a) is being used', 'b) is not being used', 'c) is always used', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: A solution to the problem of external fragmentation is ____________
options: ['a) compaction', 'b) larger memory space', 'c) smaller memory space', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: Another solution to the problem of external fragmentation problem is to ____________
options: ['a) permit the logical address space of a process to be noncontiguous', 'b) permit smaller processes to be allocated memory at last', 'c) permit larger processes to be allocated memory at last', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) permit the logical address space of a process to be noncontiguous
option2: b) permit smaller processes to be allocated memory at last
option3: c) permit larger processes to be allocated memory at last

question: If relocation is static and is done at assembly or load time, compaction _________
options: ['a) cannot be done', 'b) must be done', 'c) must not be done', 'd) can be done']

question: The disadvantage of moving all process to one end of memory and all holes to the other direction, producing one large hole of available memory is ____________
options: ['a) the cost incurred', 'b) the memory used', 'c) the CPU used', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: __________ is generally faster than _________ and _________
options: ['a) first fit, best fit, worst fit', 'b) best fit, first fit, worst fit', 'c) worst fit, best fit, first fit', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) first fit, best fit, worst fit
option2: b) best fit, first fit, worst fit
option3: c) worst fit, best fit, first fit

question: External fragmentation exists when?
options: ['a) enough total memory exists to satisfy a request but it is not contiguous', 'b) the total memory is insufficient to satisfy a request', 'c) a request cannot be satisfied even when the total memory is free', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) enough total memory exists to satisfy a request but it is not contiguous
option2: b) the total memory is insufficient to satisfy a request
option3: c) a request cannot be satisfied even when the total memory is free

question: External fragmentation will not occur when?
options: ['a) first fit is used', 'b) best fit is used', 'c) worst fit is used', 'd) no matter which algorithm is used, it will always occur']
option4: d) no matter which algorithm is used, it will always occur

question: Sometimes the overhead of keeping track of a hole might be ____________
options: ['a) larger than the memory', 'b) larger than the hole itself', 'c) very small', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option2: b) larger than the hole itself

question: When the memory allocated to a process is slightly larger than the process, then ____________
options: ['a) internal fragmentation occurs', 'b) external fragmentation occurs', 'c) both internal and external fragmentation occurs', 'd) neither internal nor external fragmentation occurs']
option3: c) both internal and external fragmentation occurs
option4: d) neither internal nor external fragmentation occurs
